contentrichtext.text: {{for|the chemical|aqua regia}} '''King Water''' is a river in the north of [[Cumbria, England]]. The [[Brampton Angling Association]] has a long term let from the [[Earl of Carlisle]] for [[fishing]] rights on a portion of the [[River Irthing]] and part of the King Water.<ref>[http://www.bramptonangling.plus.com/Memorandum%20of%20Agreement.htm 1891 River Agreement between the Earl of Carlisle and the Bramption Angling Association]</ref> [[Hadrian's Wall]] crossed the King Water to the east of the village of [[Walton, Cumbria|Walton]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{coord|54|57|N|2|44|W|display=title|region:GB_type:river_source:GNS-enwiki}} [[Category:Rivers of Cumbria]] {{Cumbria-geo-stub}}
